thread.title: Ferrari Jumps 17% in New York Stock Exchange Debut
thread.title_full: Ferrari Jumps 17% in New York Stock Exchange Debut - Bloomberg Business

author: Alex Barinka
title: Ferrari Jumps 17% in New York Stock Exchange Debut
text:
Ferrari NV climbed as much as 17 percent in its New York Stock Exchange debut after it priced its initial public offering at the top end of the marketed range.
The shares traded as high as $60.97 and were up 11 percent to $57.90 at 9:54 a.m., giving the company a market value of about $11 billion. Majority shareholder Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV raised $893 million in the IPO after investor demand in the supercar maker outstripped the stock available.
Fiat Chrysler sold a 9 percent stake in the iconic Italian brand, pricing the 17.18 million shares at $52 each, according to a statement Tuesday, after offering them for $48 to $52 apiece.
